1: Then Job replied and said this:\q1
2:
"Today I am again complaining bitterly to God;\q2 I continue to groan, but I suffer even more.


\q1
3:
I wish that I knew where I could meet with him\q2 so that I could go to the place where he lives.
\q1
4:
If I could do that, I would tell him why I know that I am innocent;\q2 I would tell him many reasons for that.
\q1
5:
Then I would find out and understand what he would reply to me.

\q1
6:
Would he use his great power to argue with me?\q2 No, he would listen to me carefully.
\q1
7:
I am an honest man, so I would be able to discuss things with him fairly,\q2 and then he would declare that I am innocent, and he would not trouble me again.


\q1
8:
However, I have gone to the east, and he is not there;\q2 I have gone to the west, but I have not found him there.
\q1
9:
I have gone north and I have gone south,\q2 but I have not seen him anywhere for he keeps himself from me.


\q1
10:
He knows how I have conducted my life;\q2 when he has finished testing me, he will see that I am as pure as gold whose impurities have all been burned out.
\q1
11:
I have faithfully walked on the road that he showed me;\q2 I have not turned away from obeying him.
\q1
12:
I have always obeyed what he commanded;\q2 I have hidden away in my inner being the words that he has spoken.


\q1
13:
He never changes. There is no one who can stop him from doing what he desires.\q2 Whatever he wants to do, he does.
\q1
14:
He will finish doing the things that he has planned for me,\q2 and I am sure that he has thought about doing many things for me.


\q1
15:
So I am terrified when I am in front of him;\q2 when I think about what he can do, I am very afraid.
\q1
16: Almighty God has made me very afraid.\q1
17: The thick darkness in front of me has not make me silent,\q2 even that terrible darkness that covers my face has not kept me from speaking."
